meanings.definition: In a manner that can be rated or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: She completed the test rateably, allowing the teacher to assess her knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The performance of the new product was rateably better than the previous one.
meanings.sent3: The cat rateably evaluated the toy mouse before deciding to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The sunflowers grew rateably taller each day, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective rateably examined the clues, piecing together the mystery.

meanings.definition: In a way that is subject to a specific rate or standard.
meanings.sent1: The internet speed was rateably slow, frustrating the users.
meanings.sent2: The factory workers were rateably efficient in completing their tasks.
meanings.sent3: The chef rateably followed the recipe, ensuring a perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: Her heartbeat raced rateably faster as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The train arrived rateably late, causing delays for the passengers.
